verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of Agur <WH94> the son <WH1121> of Jakeh, <WH3348> the oracle. <WH9294> The man <WH1397> declares <WH5002> to Ithiel, <WH384> to Ithiel <WH384> and Ucal: <WH401>
Surely <WH3588> I am more <WH4480> stupid <WH1198> than <WH4480> any <WH376> man, <WH376> And I do not have the understanding <WH998> of a man. <WH120>
Neither <WH3808> have I learned <WH3925> wisdom, <WH2451> Nor <WH3808> do I have <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the Holy <WH6918> One. <WH6918>

Who <WH4310> has ascended <WH5927> into heaven <WH8064> and descended <WH3381>? Who <WH4310> has gathered <WH622> the wind <WH7307> in His fists <WH2651>? Who <WH4310> has wrapped <WH9503> the waters <WH4325> in His garment <WH8071>? Who <WH4310> has established <WH6965> all <WH3605> the ends <WH657> of the earth <WH776>? What <WH4100> is His name <WH8034> or His son's name <WH8034>? Surely <WH3588> you know! <WH3045>
Every <WH3605> word <WH565> of God <WH433> is tested; <WH6884> He is a shield <WH4043> to those who take <WH2620> refuge <WH2620> in Him.
Do not add <WH3254> to His words <WH1697> Lest <WH6435> He reprove <WH3198> you, and you be proved <WH3576> a liar. <WH3576>
Two <WH8147> things <WH8147> I asked <WH7592> of Thee, Do not refuse <WH4513> me before <WH2962> I die: <WH4191>

Keep <WH7368> deception <WH7723> and lies <WH3577> far <WH7368> from me, Give <WH5414> me neither <WH408> poverty <WH7389> nor <WH408> riches; <WH6239> Feed <WH2963> me with the food <WH3899> that is my portion, <WH2706>

Lest <WH6435> I be full <WH7646> and deny <WH3584> [Thee] and say, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> is the Lord <WH3068>?" Or lest <WH6435> I be in want <WH3423> and steal, <WH1589> And profane <WH8610> the name <WH8034> of my God. <WH430>
Do not slander <WH3960> a slave <WH5650> to his master, <WH113> Lest <WH6435> he curse <WH7043> you and you be found <WH816> guilty. <WH816>
There is a kind <WH1755> of [man] who curses <WH7043> his father, And does not bless <WH1> his mother. <WH1288>
There is a kind <WH1755> who is pure <WH2889> in his own eyes, <WH5869> Yet is not washed <WH7364> from his filthiness. <WH6675>
There is a kind <WH1755> â€“ oh how <WH4100> lofty <WH7311> are his eyes! <WH5869> And his eyelids <WH6079> are raised <WH5375> [in arrogance.]

There is a kind <WH1755> of [man] whose teeth <WH8127> are [like] swords, <WH2719> And his jaw <WH4973> teeth <WH4973> [like] knives, <WH3979> To devour <WH398> the afflicted <WH6041> from the earth, <WH776> And the needy <WH34> from among men. <WH120>

The leech <WH5936> has two <WH8147> daughters, <WH1323> "Give, <WH3051>" "Give. <WH3051>" There <WH1992> are three <WH7969> things <WH7969> that will not be satisfied, <WH7646> Four <WH702> that will not say, <WH559> "Enough <WH1952>":

Sheol, <WH7585> and the barren <WH6115> womb, <WH7358> Earth <WH776> that is never <WH3808> satisfied <WH7646> with water, <WH4325> And fire <WH784> that never <WH3808> says, <WH559> "Enough. <WH1952>"

The eye <WH5869> that mocks <WH3932> a father, And scorns <WH1> <WH936> a mother, <WH3349> The ravens <WH517> of the valley <WH6158> will pick <WH5158> it out, And the young <WH5365> eagles <WH1121> will eat <WH5404> it.
There <WH1992> are three <WH7969> things <WH7969> which are too <WH4480> wonderful <WH6381> for me, Four <WH702> which I do not understand: <WH3045>

The way <WH1870> of an eagle <WH5404> in the sky, <WH8064> The way <WH1870> of a serpent <WH5175> on a rock, <WH6697> The way <WH1870> of a ship <WH591> in the middle <WH3820> of the sea, <WH3220> And the way <WH1870> of a man <WH1397> with a maid. <WH5959>
This <WH3651> is the way <WH1870> of an adulterous <WH5003> woman: <WH802> She eats <WH398> and wipes <WH4229> her mouth, <WH6310> And says, <WH559> "I have done <WH6466> no <WH3808> wrong. <WH205>"
Under <WH8478> three <WH7969> things <WH7969> the earth <WH776> quakes, <WH7264> And under <WH8478> four, <WH702> it cannot <WH3201> <WH3808> bear <WH5375> up:
Under <WH8478> a slave <WH5650> when <WH3588> he becomes <WH4427> king, <WH4427> And a fool <WH5036> when <WH3588> he is satisfied <WH7646> with food, <WH3899>
Under <WH8478> an unloved <WH8130> woman when <WH3588> she gets <WH1166> a husband, <WH1166> And a maidservant <WH8198> when <WH3588> she supplants <WH3423> her mistress. <WH1404>
Four <WH702> things <WH702> are small <WH6996> on the earth, <WH776> But they are exceedingly <WH2449> wise: <WH2450>
The ants <WH5244> are not a strong <WH5794> folk, <WH5971> But they prepare <WH3559> their food <WH3899> in the summer; <WH7019>
The badgers <WH9627> are not mighty <WH6099> folk, <WH5971> Yet they make <WH7760> their houses <WH1004> in the rocks; <WH5553>
The locusts <WH697> have <WH369> no <WH369> king, <WH4428> Yet all <WH3605> of them go <WH3318> out in ranks; <WH2686>
The lizard <WH8079> you may grasp <WH8610> with the hands, <WH3027> Yet it is in kings' palaces. <WH1964>
There <WH1992> are three <WH7969> things <WH7969> which are stately <WH3190> in [their] march, <WH6806> Even four <WH702> which are stately <WH3190> when they walk: <WH1980>
The lion <WH3918> [which] is mighty <WH1368> among beasts <WH929> And does not retreat <WH7725> before <WH4480> <WH6440> any, <WH3605>
The strutting <WH2223> <WH4975> cock, <WH4975> the male <WH8495> goat <WH8495> also, <WH176> And a king <WH4428> [when his] army <WH510> is with him.
If <WH518> you have been <WH9310> foolish <WH9310> in exalting <WH5375> yourself Or if <WH518> you have plotted <WH2161> [evil, put your] hand <WH3027> on your mouth. <WH6310>

For the churning <WH4330> of milk <WH2461> produces <WH3318> butter, <WH2529> And pressing <WH4330> the nose <WH639> brings <WH3318> forth <WH3318> blood; <WH1818> So the churning <WH4330> of anger <WH639> produces <WH3318> strife. <WH7379>
